title: How to Make Almond Butter Cookies

steps.headline: Add dry ingredients into bowl.
steps.description: Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, brown sugar and salt into a large bowl. Mix until well combined.

steps.headline: Add wet ingredients.
steps.description: Combine almond butter, maple syrup, vanilla extract and canola oil together in a separate large bowl until well combined.

steps.headline: Combine mixtures together.
steps.description: Carefully pour the wet ingredient batter into the dry ingredient bowl. Mix the two together until a smooth batter is formed.

steps.headline: Create 1 inch (2.5 cm) balls.
steps.description: Form the batter into cookie and place it onto a non-stick or silicone baking sheet. Spread the cookies 2–3 inches (5.1–7.6 cm) away from each other.

steps.headline: Cook the cookies.
steps.description: Place the cookies into the oven for 9 minutes or until fully cooked.

steps.headline: Allow cookies to cool.
steps.description: Remove the cookies from the oven and place them on a cooking rack to cool down a bit.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the cookies on a large plate and dig in!

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Add dry ingredients into bowl. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, brown sugar and salt into a large bowl. Mix until well combined. Add wet ingredients. Combine almond butter, maple syrup, vanilla extract and canola oil together in a separate large bowl until well combined. Combine mixtures together. Carefully pour the wet ingredient batter into the dry ingredient bowl. Mix the two together until a smooth batter is formed. Create 1 inch (2.5 cm) balls. Form the batter into cookie and place it onto a non-stick or silicone baking sheet. Spread the cookies 2–3 inches (5.1–7.6 cm) away from each other. Cook the cookies. Place the cookies into the oven for 9 minutes or until fully cooked. Allow cookies to cool. Remove the cookies from the oven and place them on a cooking rack to cool down a bit. Serve. Place the cookies on a large plate and dig in!
